solution_line_template: His first TV was {first_tv_area} square inches because {first_tv_width} x {first_tv_height} = <<{first_tv_width}*{first_tv_height}={first_tv_area}>>{first_tv_area}
His first TV cost ${first_tv_cost_per_sq_inch} per square inch because {first_tv_cost} / {first_tv_area} = <<{first_tv_cost}/{first_tv_area}={first_tv_cost_per_sq_inch}>>{first_tv_cost_per_sq_inch}
His new TV is {new_tv_area} square inches.
It costs ${new_tv_cost_per_sq_inch} per square inch because {new_tv_cost}/ {new_tv_area} = {new_tv_cost_per_sq_inch}

His old TV cost ${cost_difference} more per square inch because {first_tv_cost_per_sq_inch} - {new_tv_cost_per_sq_inch_as_per_L5} = <<{first_tv_cost_per_sq_inch}-{new_tv_cost_per_sq_inch_as_per_L5}={cost_difference}>>{cost_difference}
